Class Prey

java.lang.Object
  greenfoot.Actor
      Organism
          Fauna
              Prey

public class Prey
extends Fauna

Walks, eats, and mates. Also dies. Is eaten by predators, and eats plants and fruits.

Version:
October 21, 2013
Author:
Keith Wong

Constructor Detail

Prey

public Prey(EvolutionWorld w,
            int r,
            int g,
            int b,
            int maxImmunity,
            int maxHealth,
            int mutationRate,
            int gestationPeriod,
            int speed,
            boolean isMale)
Creates an instance of Prey.

Parameters:
r - The r color code
g - The g color code
b - The b color code
maxImmunity - the upper bound of the animal's ability to fend off disease
maxHealth - the upper bound of this' health
mutationRate - the amount of deviation from the average that this' offspring will have
gestationPeriod - how long it takes to complete a pregnancy
speed - how fast this moves
isMale - determines if this will be male or female
Method Detail

act

public void act()
Is run every Greenfoot frame. lowers hunger and thirst, causes aging, and does all the checks for predators, other prey, and food.

Overrides:
act in class greenfoot.Actor

addedToWorld

protected void addedToWorld(greenfoot.World w)
Is run once this is put into the world. Basically just creates the things that follow this around.

Overrides:
addedToWorld in class greenfoot.Actor
Parameters:
w - The world that this is in.

checkForPredators

protected void checkForPredators()
Looks within a certain radius (100) and then finds the best angle to run away at.

die

public void die()
removes itself and all other objects associated with it. Also adds nutrients back into the soil.

Overrides:
die in class Organism

findNewDes

public void findNewDes()
Finds a new destination for this. If it's not supposed to move, lowers the rest counter by 1.

hide

protected void hide()
If there is something targeting this, then it proceeds to run towards the closest Tree or Bush. Stops looking to hide if there are no predators in the area.
